conclusion: Need to analyze the v-t graph to determine motion direction from 2 to 3 seconds.
Positive direction is defined by increasing velocity on the v-t graph.
Positive direction corresponds to velocities greater than zero.
At t = 2 seconds, the velocity is zero.
From t = 2 to t = 3 seconds, velocity decreases linearly to -2 m/s.
Negative velocities indicate motion in the opposite direction of the positive direction.
Since velocity is negative from t = 2 to t = 3 seconds, motion is opposite to the defined positive direction.
The motion direction of the particle from 2 to 3 seconds is opposite to the defined positive direction.
